intro: Apteranthes europaea var. simonis, commonly known as the European narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often with a slightly hairy texture. It is a perennial herb that produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
